010package imagingbook.common.color.colorspace;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.color.colorspace.StandardIlluminant.D50;
013import static imagingbook.common.color.colorspace.StandardIlluminant.D65;
014
015import java.awt.color.ColorSpace;
016
017import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
018import imagingbook.common.math.PrintPrecision;
019
020
021// D65 tristimulus: 0.9504, 1.0000, 1.0888
022
023/**
024 * This class implements the sRGBcolor space with D65 white point. 
025 * Components of all {@code float[]} colors
026 * are supposed to be in [0,1]. This is a singleton class with no public
027 * constructors, use {@link #getInstance()} to obtain the single instance.
028 * 
029 * @author WB
030 * @version 2022/11/07
031 */
032public class sRgbColorSpace extends CustomColorSpace {
033        private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
034
035        private static final sRgbColorSpace instance = new sRgbColorSpace();
036        
037        // chromatic adaptation objects:
038        private static final ChromaticAdaptation catD65toD50 = BradfordAdaptation.getInstance(D65, D50);
039        private static final ChromaticAdaptation catD50toD65 = BradfordAdaptation.getInstance(D50, D65);
040        private static final GammaMappingFunction GammaMap = GammaMappingFunction.sRGB;
041        
042        public static sRgbColorSpace getInstance() {
043                return instance;
044        }
045        
046        /** Matrix for conversion from XYZ to linear RGB. */
047        public static final double[][] Mrgbi = CieUtil.Mrgb65i;
048        
049        /** Matrix for conversion from linear RGB to XYZ (inverse of {@link #Mrgbi}). */
050        public static final double[][] Mrgb = CieUtil.Mrgb65;
051
052
053//      private static final float[][] MrgbiF = Matrix.toFloat(Mrgbi);
054//      private static final float[][] MrgbF = Matrix.toFloat(Mrgb);
055        
056        // ----------------------------------------------------
057        
058        public double[] getPrimary(int idx) {
059                return Matrix.getColumn(Mrgbi, idx);
060        }
061        
062        // The white point of D65 (
063        public double[] getWhiteXYZ() {
064                return Matrix.multiply(Mrgbi, new double[] {1, 1, 1});
065                // {0.95045, 1.000000000, 1.08905}
066        }
067        
068        // ----------------------------------------------------
069        
070        /**
071         * Constructor (not public).
072         */
073        private sRgbColorSpace() {
074                super(ColorSpace.TYPE_RGB, 3);
075        }
076        
077        // direct conversion from/to D65-based XYZ space ------------------------------
078        
079        public double[] fromCIEXYZ65(double[] xyz65) {
080                double[] rgb = Matrix.multiply(Mrgb, xyz65);    // linear RGB
081                // perform forward gamma mapping:
082                double[] srgb = new double[3];                                                                  
083                for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
084                        srgb[i] = GammaMap.applyFwd(rgb[i]);
085                }
086                return srgb;
087        }
088        
089        public double[] toCIEXYZ65(double[] srgbTHIS) {
090                // get linear rgb components:
091                double[] rgb = new double[3];
092                for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
093                        rgb[i] = GammaMap.applyInv(srgbTHIS[i]);
094                }
095                // convert to D65-based XYZ (Poynton / ITU 709) 
096                double[] xyz65 = Matrix.multiply(Mrgbi, rgb);
097                return xyz65;
098        }
099        
100        // Methods required ColorSpace (conversion from/to PCS space) ------------------
101
102        // assumes xyz50 is in D50-based CS_CIEXYZ color space
103        // TODO: check double/float mix
104        @Override
105        public double[] fromCIEXYZ(double[] xyz50PCS) {
106                double[] xyz65 = catD50toD65.applyTo(xyz50PCS);
107                return this.fromCIEXYZ65(xyz65);
108        }
109        
110//      public float[] fromCIEXYZ(float[] xyz50PCS) {
111//              double[] xyz65 = catD50toD65.applyTo(Matrix.toDouble(xyz50PCS));
112//              double[] rgb = Matrix.multiply(Mrgb, xyz65);    // linear RGB
113//              // perform forward gamma mapping:
114//              float[] srgb = new float[3];                                                                    
115//              for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
116//                      srgb[i] = (float) sRgbUtil.gammaFwd(rgb[i]);
117//              }
118//              return srgb;
119//      }
120
121        // returned colors are in D50-based CS_CIEXYZ color space 
122        // TODO: check double/float mix
123        @Override
124        public double[] toCIEXYZ(double[] srgbTHIS) {
125                double[] xyz65 = this.toCIEXYZ65(srgbTHIS);
126                double[] xyz50 = catD65toD50.applyTo(xyz65);
127                return xyz50;
128        }
129        
130//      public float[] toCIEXYZ(float[] srgbTHIS) {
131//              // get linear rgb components:
132//              double[] rgb = new double[3];
133//              for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
134//                      rgb[i] = sRgbUtil.gammaInv(srgbTHIS[i]);
135//              }
136//              // convert to D65-based XYZ (Poynton / ITU 709) 
137//              double[] xyz65 = Matrix.multiply(Mrgbi, rgb);
138//              double[] xyz50 = catD65toD50.applyTo(xyz65);
139//              return Matrix.toFloat(xyz50);
140//      }
141        
142        // ----------------------------------------------------
143        
144        @Override // no conversion needed, since this is sRGB
145        public double[] fromRGB(double[] srgb) {
146                return srgb;
147        }
148
149        @Override // no conversion needed, since this is sRGB
150        public double[] toRGB(double[] srgbTHIS) {
151                return srgbTHIS;
152        }
153        
154        // ----------------------------------------------------
155        
156        private static final String[] ComponentNames = {"R65", "G65", "B65"};
157        
158        @Override
159        public String getName (int idx) {
160                return ComponentNames[idx];
161        }
162        
163        // ------------------------------------------------------------
164        
165        public static void main(String[] args) {
166                PrintPrecision.set(15);
167                sRgbColorSpace cs = sRgbColorSpace.getInstance();
168                
169                
170                System.out.println("Mrgbi = \n" + Matrix.toString(Mrgbi) + "\n");
171                System.out.println("Mrgb = \n" + Matrix.toString(Mrgb) + "\n");
172                
173                double[] trist1 = Matrix.multiply(Mrgbi, new double[] {1,1,1});
174                System.out.println("W  = " + Matrix.toString(trist1));
175                System.out.println("Xr = " + Matrix.toString(Matrix.multiply(Mrgbi, new double[] {1,0,0})));
176                System.out.println("Xg = " + Matrix.toString(Matrix.multiply(Mrgbi, new double[] {0,1,0})));
177                System.out.println("Xb = " + Matrix.toString(Matrix.multiply(Mrgbi, new double[] {0,0,1})));
178                
179                double[] whiteXYZ = cs.getWhiteXYZ();
180                System.out.println("getWhiteXYZ() = " + Matrix.toString(whiteXYZ));
181                System.out.println("          xy = " + Matrix.toString(CieUtil.XYZToXy(whiteXYZ)));     // {0.3457029085924369, 0.3585385827835399}
182                
183                
184//              ColorSpace cs1 = sRgb50ColorSpace.getInstance();
185//              ColorSpace cs2 = ColorSpace.getInstance(ColorSpace.CS_sRGB);
186//              PrintPrecision.set(6);
187//              for(int c = 0; c < 256; c++) {
188//                      int[] srgb = {c, 0, 0};
189//                      float[] srgbA = RgbUtils.normalize(srgb);
190//                      float[] xyz1 = cs1.toCIEXYZ(srgbA);
191//                      float[] xyz2 = cs2.toCIEXYZ(srgbA);
192//                      System.out.println(Arrays.toString(srgb) + " -> " +
193//                                      Matrix.toString(xyz1) + " / " +
194//                                      Matrix.toString(xyz2));
195//              }
196                
197        }
198
199
200}
